In the grassy plain, the two mech-humans slowly advance, Katya 
deliberately slowing down so the heavier Ragnar could catch up with 
her. She was willing to know more of him, after he had left the true 
Wolves.

Katya: Tell me, Ragnar, how was it with Phelan? And what happened in 
the Arc-Royal Defense Cordon?

Ragnar smiled: Well, it has been a job to keep the Jade Falcons back 
as we could from the cordon. The Kell Hounds did help a lot, and their 
mech facilities helped us to rebuild a rather strong touman. Then, I 
was captured by the Bears...

Katya: Ah yes! I remember Bjorn Jorgensson saying once you were a key 
element for the Ghost Bears. What then?

Ragnar thought for a moment.

Ragnar: Bjorn is a man I can call my friend, a soldier I can call a 
true warrior, and a politician of the kind of the Kerenskys! He 
trusted me, pushed me back to the warrior's way and eventually gave me 
command of the Rasalhague Bears. I never actually dreamt of commanding 
warriors of my former nation among the Clans...

Katya remembered the time he was a wolf. A young and bright freeborn 
warrior of kind of Phelan Kell. He would have been bloodnamed too if 
he had proved to have common genetic material with clan bloodlines.

Her mind drifted and she looked at the sky. Her warden tendencies 
never prevented her to rise in a crusader clan, but she did not like 
the idea that she would not be totally able to prevent Vlad Ward to 
conquer the Inner Sphere.

She saw something in the sky and magnified to see enough of it. 
Unfortunately, she still could not make out what it was.

Katya: There is something coming. It seems metallic and it is coming 
fast.

Ragnar: Then we prepare...

Both transformed, once more becoming the war machines they guised as, 
ready to fight if need be.
